meanings.definition: A person or company that installs or maintains cables.
meanings.sent1: The cabler fixed the internet cables in our neighborhood.
meanings.sent2: The cabler arrived promptly to repair the damaged cables.
meanings.sent3: The cabler joked that untangling cables was like solving a giant puzzle.
meanings.sent4: She was a cabler, weaving connections between homes like a spider spinning its web.
meanings.sent5: The cabler's job is crucial for keeping our communication lines open.

meanings.sent1: We subscribed to the cabler for our favorite TV channels.
meanings.sent2: The cabler offers a variety of packages for cable TV services.
meanings.sent3: The cabler's logo featured a cartoon character surfing on a cable.
meanings.sent4: In a world of entertainment, the cabler was the wizard behind the curtain.
meanings.sent5: The cabler's commercials always make me crave popcorn and movie nights.

meanings.definition: To provide with cable television service.
meanings.sent1: I will cabler your new apartment next week.
meanings.sent2: The technician will cabler the entire building for high-speed internet.
meanings.sent3: He decided to cabler the entire neighborhood as a surprise gift.
meanings.sent4: She cablered the house with so many channels, it felt like a dream.
meanings.sent5: The company promised to cabler every home with the best shows available.
